meanings.definition: To encircle or bind with a belt or girdle.
meanings.sent1: She was upgirding her dress with a colorful belt.
meanings.sent2: The knight upgirded his sword before the battle.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer upgirded the outfit with a stylish belt.
meanings.sent4: The vines upgirding the tree created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The belt upgirded her waist, completing the look.

meanings.sent1: The pillars upgirded the roof of the ancient temple.
meanings.sent2: His encouraging words upgirded her confidence.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between them upgirded their spirits during tough times.
meanings.sent4: The foundation upgirded the entire building, keeping it stable.
meanings.sent5: The team upgirded each other, working together towards success.

meanings.definition: To prepare or equip for action.
meanings.sent1: The coach was upgirding the team for the championship match.
meanings.sent2: She upgirded herself with knowledge before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The soldiers upgirded their weapons for the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent4: The chef upgirded the kitchen with all the necessary ingredients.
meanings.sent5: The adventurer upgirded for the journey ahead, packing essential supplies.
